New Records: Stephen Curry scored a season-high 37 points, the second consecutive game with a season-high mark (36, 11/10 at OKC).
Kevon Looney grabbed nine offensive rebounds in 15 minutes, tying for the third player in league history to do so in 15 minutes or fewer.
Key Match Events: Stephen Curry's 12 consecutive points to close the game, marking his second career game with 12 or more points to end a game.
Curry's game-sealing free throws capped a season-high 37-point outing, leading all players in points (37) and assists (9).
Klay Thompson's return to Chase Center was marked with a standing ovation and video tribute, adding emotional significance to the game.
Pre-Game Insights: The game carried extra significance as the opener of the Emirates NBA Cup.
Stephen Curry was vocal and a showman, celebrating his highlight plays and leading the team with a complete game.
Post-Match Reflections: Stephen Curry expressed pride in the team's effort after the comeback win.
The Warriors improved to 1-0 in Emirates NBA Cup play and discussed their strong performance and preparation.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Warriors led by as many as 11 points and came back to win, marking their third double-figure comeback victory of the season.
The game was the 522nd consecutive sellout at Chase Center, the third-longest active streak in the NBA.
Others: The Warriors improved to 7-1 in games against the Western Conference and have a best start since the 2021-22 season (9-2 through 11 games).
Curry tallied a season-high two blocked shots, a career-high mark.
